comments:
I am using Eclipse 3.01 as the PDE for an IBM product based upon RAD. For some 
reason, sometimes the bundles do not all activate properly. I had this problem 
several weeks ago, and a switched the target JVM from the version shipped with 
WebSphere Application Server 6.0 (an IBM 1.42) to the JVM which originates from 
RAD (also an IBM 1.42, though a slightly different one), and the problem 
stopped. Then it started again yesterday, but I really cannot isolate the 
change that did it. I believe that the change I made was to add a dependency to 
a plugin other than the one mentioned below, but why that would cause a variety 
of unrelated plugins not to activate does not make much sense to me. 

I ran across the runtime spy and installed that in my target workbench. I can 
see the plugins in the manifest view which are not being initialized, and I do 
not see them in the activated pugin view. 

This is the log entry that I currently get consistently. Again, the bundle 
where the class that cannot be found resides loaded consistently for some time. 
Then after altering another bundle from the PDE and relaunching, this class 
could no longer be found. 

!SESSION Feb 23, 2005 08:31:31.569 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM J9 2.2 Windows XP x86-32 j9n142ifx-20041102 
(JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20040916_0908_lHdSMR

Command-line arguments: -product com.ibm.wbit.feature.ide -pdelaunch

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 1 Feb 23, 2005 08:31:31.569
!MESSAGE Executable extension definition for "class" not found.

If someone could provide what trace spec I would need to see if there is a 
dependent plugin which is not initializing, I would appreciate that. This info 
is not automatically logged as it was in releases prior to the OSGI based 
runtime.

Please make sure you pass -clean when launching a runtime workbench after you
make changes (add/remove plug-ins, change plug-in manifests, add/rename
packages). Let us know if that helps.

Yes, I always pass -clean in as an argument. 

From the Program Arguments section of my Runtime Workbench configuration:
-os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -nl en_US -clean

Please try this then:

1) create a new runtime workbench launch configuration from scratch
2) configure it appropriately (any interesting details in your scenario here?)
3) make sure you set a new empty workspace location
3) launch the configuration
4) in the runtime workbench just launched, please open the Error log view
(Window > Show view > Other... > PDE Runtime > Error Log)
5) any entries so far, or do you have to build a project containing the
mentioned builder? If so, please use the "Open log" action to find the log file
and attach the full log here.

Things that may prevent classes from being loaded/found even though PDE builds
your plug-in appropriately:
- error during plug-in activation - does not seem to be the problem, you would
get a log entry for that;
- unresolved optional pre-requisites - enable tracing globally (Tracing tab in
the launch configuration) to see these
- class not exported - make sure you do not have a bundle manifest
(META-INF/MANIFEST.MF) in the involved plug-ins. They both may contain
(potentially different) runtime settings and this may introduce inconsistencies.

> If someone could provide what trace spec I would need to see if 
> there is a dependent plugin which is not initializing, I would 
> appreciate that. This info is not automatically logged as it 
> was in releases prior to the OSGI based runtime. 

I am not sure what you mean by initializing here
(installing/resolving/activating?), but on the same tracing tab, you can enable
tracing for org.eclipse.osgi. On the debug options list on the right, make sure
you check the "debug" debug option.

I added a button to the workbench so I could force my bundle to load more 
directly, and it is loading fine. The problem must be in one of the plugins 
that I am depending upon to invoke my code. I am still baffled by the fact that 
it was working, and then stopped, but I am not too concerned with that at this 
point since I have bypassed enough code to get mine working. 

Thanks for helping me out.
